Welcome! This page demonstrates inline macros, a step box, and a collapsible box.

# 1) Inline macros

- Variable: [x]{.var}, [y]{.var}
- Defined term: [standard deviation]{.def}
- Descriptor/UI label: [Frequency]{.des}
- Dataset: [Cars]{.data}
- Dropdown selection: [Mean]{.dpd}
- Function: [lm]{.fun}
- Dialog name: [Descriptive Statistics]{.dialog}
- Repository: [Rguroo Datasets]{.repo}
- Answer: [42]{.ans}

Mixed in prose: we compute the [mean]{.fun} of [mpg]{.var} from [Cars]{.data} in the [Descriptive Statistics]{.dialog} dialog.

# 2) Step box (HTML + PDF)

::: {.step tabindex="0" role="note" aria-label="Example step-by-step instructions"}
<span class="step-title">Step-by-step instructions</span>

1. Open the [Descriptive Statistics]{.dialog} dialog.  
2. Choose [Mean]{.dpd} from the dropdown menu.  
3. Load the [Cars]{.data} dataset.  
4. Fit a linear model with [lm]{.fun}: response = [mpg]{.var}, predictor = [weight]{.var}.  
5. Interpret the results. The [answer]{.ans} should be clear.

![Cover picture (for demo).](images/Cover_picture.jpg){#fig-waterfall width=60% fig-cap="Figure: Example image used inside a step box." fig-alt="A cover picture demonstrating figure placement."}
:::

We can refer to the image as @fig-waterfall in both HTML and PDF.
